sdg-SL_TLF_UEM-_O-15+.def: The unemployment rate is calculated by dividing the total number of unemployed (for a country or a specific group of workers) by the corresponding labour force, which itself is the sum of the total persons employed and unemployed in the group. Persons in unemployment are defined as all those of working age who were not in employment, carried out activities to seek employment during a specified recent period and were currently available to take up employment given a job opportunity.
sdg-SL_TLF_UEM-_O-15+.name: Unemployment rate, by sex and age (%)
sdg-SL_TLF_UEM-_O-15+.source: Source: ILO modelled estimates, November 2021, available in ILOSTAT (https://ilostat.ilo.org/). For the specific sources by country and the estimation methodology refer to ILOSTAT directly.
